title: Yi.. Please nerf Yi... PLEASE NERF YI!!! :(
body: Just so sick of this champ, owns in every game and you cant target him he's too fast then invisible and it sucks. All these other champs are nerfd, it is way past Yi's turn. He's the champ that the majority hate and rage about. Please, I cringe everytime I see a Yi player. And they are always so rude too.

Thank for you help!

I believe that was sarcasm. Also, its a game when you aren't the only person to count against a yi. But he IS op. He is the most op champ in the game and he hasn't been touched in years, that's saying something

That's because he isn't OP. He is what is called a "hypercarrry", which basically means he snowballs like a mofo. Because he is aa reliant, items like Randuin's Omen, Frozen Heart, and Thornmail really gives him a hard time. Also, if he is against a team with Leona or some other lock-down champ, then he seriously can't do anything once teamfights start to happen.

"most OP champ in-game"

Completely demolished by "trash tier" champion...

Yi's counter is heavy CC like stuns,snares,  knockups, knock backs (especially).
My favourite counter to Yi is Quinn. You counter everything he does. With sufficient damage you destroy him.

Try saving your CC for after he Alpha Strikes or else he'll just dodge it with it. 

Yi is traditionally squishy as well. Stun him and kill him, get a Morgana to snare him. A Ryze to snare if etc. He's not OP. 
Late Game Rammus destroys him. But Rammus isn't particularly great at the moment - overall.

Not saying people don't have valid points, but when one champ can carry an entire team that is otherwise losing, back to victory, it needs looking into. Normally you can't account for a yi, except everyone is playing him all of a sudden (where's the skill gone?), but it would mean always playing less interesting champs just to counter the yi. Garen is op, I don't complain about him. Zed is beyond op, but he at least requires some skill. Yi just needs a little nerfing, or at least a look into to see how to balance him out better.
